title: KTESIOS
content:
KTESIOS (Ctesius) was the spirit-protector (daimon) of the household. Ktesios and Soter (father of
        Ktesios) were also cult titles of the god Zeus.

SOTER & PRAXIDIKE (Suidas
          s.v. Praxidike)

Suidas s.v. Praxidike (trans. Suda On Line) (Byzantine Greek Lexicon C10th A.D.)
          :
        "Praxidike (Exacter of Justice) : A deity whose head alone is venerated. Mnaseas [Greek C2nd B.C.] in his
        treatise On Europe says that Soter (Saviour) and his sister Praxidike (Exacter of Justice) had a son
        Ktesios (Ctesius. Household) and daughters Homonoia (Concord) and Arete (Virtue), who were called Praxidikai
        (Exacters of Penalties) after their mother."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
